intro: Decalophium pauciflorum, commonly known as the few-flowered decalophium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate or elliptic in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, a characteristic feature of the Euphorbiaceae family. Decalophium pauciflorum is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
